description:
Aspergillus sydowii CBS 593.65 is a filamentous fungal species that belongs to the genus Aspergillus. It is a member of the Aspergillus section Versicolores, which are known to produce various secondary metabolites.

Aspergillus sydowii is a common environmental fungus that can be found in various habitats, including soil, indoor environments, and plant materials. The strain CBS 593.65 was isolated from soil collected in the Netherlands.

Morphologically, A. sydowii CBS 593.65 produces conidiophores with smooth-walled stipes and globose to subglobose vesicles. The conidial heads are typically biseriate, with phialides arising from the upper two-thirds of the vesicle. The conidia are smooth-walled, subglobose to ellipsoidal in shape.

Genetically, A. sydowii CBS 593.65 has been characterized and its genome has been sequenced, providing insights into its phylogenetic relationships and potential metabolic capabilities. This strain has been used in various research studies, particularly in the field of fungal taxonomy, ecology, and secondary metabolite production.
